trans-unit.source: The permission that is demanded by <see cref="N:System.Transactions" /> when management of a transaction is escalated to MSDTC.
This class cannot be inherited.
A local transaction only consumes resources from a single durable source or mutilple volatitle sources.
trans-unit.target: Eine lokale Transaktion belegt nur Ressourcen aus einer einzigen dauerhaften Quelle oder mehreren flüchtigen Quellen.

trans-unit.source: A distributed transaction, on the other hand, has to interact with multiple durable resources, potentially across the network.
trans-unit.target: Eine verteilte Transaktion wurde andererseits, über das Netzwerk möglicherweise mit mehreren dauerhaften Ressourcen interagieren.

trans-unit.source: When management of a transaction is escalated to MSDTC, the code that initiated the escalation is verified to have this permission.
trans-unit.target: Bei der Verwaltung einer Transaktion an MSDTC eskaliert wird, wird der Code, der die Eskalation initiiert überprüft, um diese Berechtigung verfügen.

trans-unit.source: For more information on security levels, see [Security Trust Levels in Accessing Resources](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8e45acbc-0d81-4f64-9da7-8f766aebff51).
trans-unit.target: Weitere Informationen zu Sicherheitsstufen, finden Sie unter [vertrauen Sicherheitsstufen in den Zugriff auf Ressourcen](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8e45acbc-0d81-4f64-9da7-8f766aebff51).

trans-unit.source: For more information on transaction management escalation, see [Transaction Management Escalation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5b87ae58-8ccf-4b9b-9715-41e4aade89b7).
trans-unit.target: Weitere Informationen zu Management transaktionseskalation, finden Sie unter [Management Transaktionseskalation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5b87ae58-8ccf-4b9b-9715-41e4aade89b7).

trans-unit.source: The security demand affects the code that initiated the escalation, not necessarily the code that originally created the local transaction.
trans-unit.target: Der sicherheitsforderung wirkt sich auf den Code, der die Eskalation initiiert, nicht unbedingt auf den Code, der die lokale Transaktion ursprünglich erstellt.

trans-unit.source: One of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState" /> values.
Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Transactions.DistributedTransactionPermission" /> class.
Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
A copy of the current permission.
The XML encoding used to reconstruct the permission.
Reconstructs a permission with a specified state from an XML encoding.
A permission to intersect with the current permission.
It must be the same type as the current permission.
Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
This new permission is <see langword="null" /> if the intersection is empty.
A permission to test for the subset relationship.
This permission must be the same type as the current permission.
Returns a value that indicates whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
<see langword="true" /> if the current <see cref="T:System.Security.IPermission" /> is a subset of the specified <see cref="T:System.Security.IPermission" />; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
Returns a value that indicates whether unrestricted access to the resource that is protected by the current permission is allowed.
<see langword="true" /> if unrestricted use of the resource protected by the permission is allowed; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
A <see cref="T:System.Security.SecurityElement" /> that contains the XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
A permission to combine with the current permission.
It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
An <see cref="T:System.Security.IPermission" /> that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
